body.p: Enclosed find petition of those boys of whom I spoke to you some time ago, who were indicted in the Casey Circuit Court, I have also enclosed my own affidavit as to the agreement, Owsley persisits in saying he does not recollect it.

p.note: If you can have the amount of the bond in blank so that I may fill up correctly after writing to the clerk. It is probably that the petition is incorrect in amounts. ELV.

body.p:
He insists that you ought not to deprive you him of his part of the forfeiture I insist that it would be outrageous for him to take it & urge you if you think I am right to have remission forwarded to me at once at
this place (Somerset) The boys pray pardon of the crime also. They were guilty as I know from the proof before the Grand jury which I heard, but were all drunk in a devilish frolick on their way home from the Bear Wallow.
They belong to good families, were always honest, and well behaved- up to that time and are now as good soldiers as Wolford has in his Regiment, faithful, and true.
You have the facts & can do as you deem just & right in the premises &c
I would be glad to hear from you How about your Inp East?

Yours Truly
E L Van Winkle
Have got another big case in ct of appeals from here.
